channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Progressive Regulator Winning Over the Populist Right
item.description: Lina Khan wants to overthrow “the autocrats of trade.”

item.title: Fed’s Interest-Rate Approach Keeps It on Collision Course With Trump
item.description: The central bank signals little urgency to cut interest rates despite demands from President Trump for lower borrowing costs.

item.title: No Rock Stars, No Mercedes: A Russian Expo Shows the Cost of Divorce With the West
item.description: The annual economic forum in St. Petersburg used to yield multibillion-dollar deals and feature performances by global music stars. With the war in Uk...

item.title: How Juneteenth and Black America helped shape U.S. cuisine
item.description: Food and cooking play a big role in Juneteenth celebrations. The barbecues and fish fries woven into Black culture helped shape American cuisine.

item.title: Trump's VA cut a program that's saving vets' homes. Even Republicans have questions
item.description: NPR has heard from more than 50 veterans around the country who are upset about the VA cutting a program that was helping vets avoid foreclosure. Vete...

item.title: Photos: How torn pictures and trusted herbs create healing in Colombia
item.description: Conflict has sewn trauma in the western region of Colombia. Doctors Without Borders is working with local healers and health care professionals to com...

item.title: Inside a school that's working to fix the U.S. shortage of air traffic controllers
item.description: Facing a severe shortage, the FAA is racing to hire thousands of air traffic controllers. But training them can take years. We visit a school in Flori...

item.title: Israel vows to intensify attacks after Iranian missile hits major hospital

item.title: The Crane That Ruined Florence’s Skyline Is Gone
item.description: A reviled crane used during the expansion of the Uffizi Galleries was taken down this week after years of protests.
